    • Constructor Detail

      • Line

        public Line(int x1,
            int y1,
            int x2,
            int y2)
        Creates a line segment
        Parameters:
        x1 - the x position of the first point
        y1 - the y position of the first point
        x2 - the x position of the second point
        y2 - the y position of the second point

    • Method Detail

        public int getX2()
        Accessor for points on the line
        Returns:
        the value of x2

        Accessor for points on the line
        Returns:
        the value of y2

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(Line other)
        Checks if two lines segments are touching
        Parameters:
        other - the other line object that this line object is compared with
        Returns:
        a boolean which is true if the lines are touching

      • setPoint2

        public void setPoint2(int x2,
                      int y2)
        Sets the second point on the line
        Parameters:
        x2 - the x position of the second point on the line segment
        y2 - the y position of the second point on the line segment

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Draws the line segment onto the PApplet
        Specified by:
        draw in class Shape
        Precondition
        All styles must be set before the draw() method is called. SetSurface must be called to assign a PApplet to which the Shape is to be drawn.
        Postcondition
        The PApplet associated with the rectangle object now contains a rectangle. The x, y, width, and height are cast to floats, so the precision will be reduced.
